alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mingo, south central Lincoln, Logan, north central Wyoming and southwestern Boone Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Holden, or 10 miles north of Williamson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Logan, Chapmanville, Man, Delbarton, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Chief Logan State, Holden, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Chattaroy, Red Jacket, Harts, West Logan, Kermit, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Chauncey, Myrtle and Sharples. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
